Name: The top of a sistrum handle
Description: The sistrum is a musical instrument which served as a rattle and which was used in certain rites, as for example in the one to appease the goddess Hathor. In the shaking, it produced a rhythmic rustling caused by the moving rods which traversed its frame and which were sometimes provided with little bells. This fragment in wood consists of the upper part of the sistrum. It depicts a Hathoric head surmounted by the facade of a naos in which a uraeus is represented.
